Our proven business systems that we teach are constantly helping students leave their old jobs behind because of the revenue they create by selling online, regardless of their prior experience.

item.title: Video Ads Genius 2.0
item.description: Name : Video Ads Genius 2.0 Vendor : Justin Sardi, Ray Lane Size : 1.1 GB Type : Youtube Ads Courses Price : $418 Homepage : SalePage Video Ads Genius 2.0 is Revolutionary Packaged inside the training are over 4 hours of 1080p content created with the sole purpose of teaching our customers to profit from Youtube Ads. Two top 6-figures Youtube experts have partnered up to rock your list! With great proof and testimonials, we are confident this product will be a great buy for your audience.
item.yandex:full-text: Features Youtube is Big, And Getting Bigger It’s no secret by now that EVERYONE watches Youtube videos. They are fun, and literally every niche is represented on Youtube. Your perfect target customer included. Youtube gets 4 BILLION views PER DAY. Video Ads Are Cheaper and Better than Facebook Ads Think about it: when someone watches a Youtube video, you know they are interested in that topic RIGHT NOW, compared to Facebook “likes” and “interests” that mean very little.. Also, Youtube ads are cheaper due to lower competition. You DON’T Need to Be Good At Making Videos Let’s say it once and for all: video ads are not hard to make. Better yet -we will show you how to crank out your first video ads in just minutes, using softwares that won’t cost you a single dime (you’ll thank us later) Results That Speak For Themselves Youtube is making us an insane ROI, and we have successfully taught total newbies how to generate commissions using Youtube. With nothing left out, our training dives deep into what it takes to use Youtube ads to run traffic to any webpage. Most revolutionary Traffic Method Youtube is the next frontier of advertising. The platform gets 4 billion views a day, in every single niche you can think of. Stay ahead of the curve and only teach your list the valuable stuff that will hep them grow Our world-class support is always available to take care of our customers.

item.title: Fan Page Domination
item.description: Name : Fan Page Domination Vendor : Anthony Morrison Size : 5.1 GB Type : Facebook Courses Price : $1997 Homepage : SalePage Fan Page Domination is a way to leverage Fan Pages from Facebook to create tons of traffic in order to make the email list bigger and bigger. It is created by Anthony Morrison in his first training course. It shows the way he builds a fan page of more than 500,000 fans whereas still succeeding in building an email list of more than 200,000 subscribers.
item.yandex:full-text: Features This Fan Page Domination is aimed to show you how amazing this programs can be. And one of the reasons for that is it can show you how to create huge amounts of traffic and email list which is a prerequisite to increasing your revenue on FB fan pages. This is really amazing, isn’t it? You can increase fans and do not have to pay any extra money at all. Fan Page Domination is divided into 4 separated stages: Stage 1: Setup & Started – This stage shows you how to create a big fan page. It starts from simple things such as Auto-Responders to Surveys, therefore no matter what knowledge you have about Inte.com Marketing, you can always improve your fan page via this amazing Fan Page Domination course. Stage 2: Build & Grow – In this part, you will learn about the content of your post so that you can grasp as much attention as possible from the viewers. This stage is very necessary as it helps you increase the number of fans of your fan page. Stage 3: Scale & Launch – Anthony will then show you how he can create a fan page with more than over 295,000 viewers without having to pay a penny for it. Stage 4: M.comize & Profit – The last stage Anthony will then show you all of the tricks he knew to grow online business and increase sales. I bet you all like it because I also like it.

item.title: The Anatomy of Link Building Explained: What You Should Know?
item.description: Link building is a pretty powerful technique that can boost your rankings wildly if you get to understand it well enough. It can also be your worst nightmare and the cause of your site’s complete downfall if not worked right. Both ways, it is an amazing SEO technique that has been working for many people for decades now. In fact, up until now it is has been a significant contribution to wonderful rankings of many authoritative sites you know out there in many niches. The biggest problem though with many people who use link building in their sites is that they regularly make use of bad practices that are set on cutting corners on responsibilities to achieve easy rankings. Google is comfortably able to capture and punish those that use these bad strategies using frequently algorithm updates. These tricks commonly known as black hat linking. You need to avoid these techniques in every possible way if you want to make your website become an authority in your niche and achieve the level of success you have in mind. The best way for you to keep off these bad practices is through getting to understand the very anatomy of link building. Having known the most important aspects of link building, you will be able to find out what’s best and what’s not and how to make the most of what’s best. So to help you get the gist of this useful SEO technique here is what you need to know about link building:
item.yandex:full-text: What is Link Building? This is basically having external links that point to your website on other external pages and posts of other websites. Link building gives more exposure to your site, get better rankings on popular search engines and direct a good deal of traffic to your site for conversions or sales or any other intended purpose. If you have links, especially in websites that have ranked in the first three positions in Google, Bing or Yahoo, it may have a huge positive impact regarding exposure on your site. Just take a second and think, how much traffic does the website that’s ranked the first get every day? A huge load of it! And what if you could tap into it and share the traffic with your site? That would really make a huge difference in your site. So if you can manage to talk that site’s owner into letting you leave a link or a couple of them there, you can get to see a significant rise in rankings in your online business. And that’s how link building came to be! No, Follow vs. Do Follow Links The do follow types of links have been around for a long time, but a no follow link has been around since 2005, after a dire need to solve the issue of spammers of other people’s sites securing good places for their sites in the search engines. Let’s catch a good glimpse of these types of links. A do follow link is a link that is counted as a point by Google search bots and adds more into the link juice that boosts a site’s rankings in the SERPs. What this basically means is that it is a link left on a website (like New York Times or Forbes), and it passes link power to the site where the link is pointing. Having more of these shows Google that many people are linking to a certain page to your site, which then means that the page must be really good. And in Google’s effort to deliver quality to their users, they will rank the page higher in the SERP’s to help many people find it and enjoy it as well. A no follow link is a link that doesn’t count in the placing of your site in the search engines. There is no link juice for this kind of link, which means that it’s not going to make any difference to the site of the person who left it. There is actually a HTML attribute for this link. Here it is -> ” <a href=”http://www.website.com/”; rel=”nofollow”>Link Text</a>” What the attribute says is that this link should not count on its players. As said earlier, this link came to be after many people realized that the most inbound links there were for their sites, no matter where or how could gain them a boost. This later leads to a messy situation where links were all over the place, and now it was not a matter of authenticity but a dirty competition to win good positions. So getting the links not to make any difference or bring any pointers to their destination was the perfect solution. Are no follow links worth it then? Sure they are! Although they don’t exert any SEO energy, they usually serve a good way of getting referral traffic that can then be channel the traffic your site and give you a lot of leads and conversions too! If well placed as a blog comment or a post it can really make more impact than rankings would. The main reason for fighting for good rankings is to get more traffic, and if you get leads and conversions out of the no follow links instead of rankings, then they are well worth the short! Importance of Link Building in Ranking a Keyword If you are looking for making money online then you must rank your money keywords on Google top three positions. Link building is the way to go! If you have been wondering how to rank a keyword that you have found a fit for awesome conversions and would want to have a good placing under it, inbound links can help you do that. What you will only need to do is to write a good article on that keyword, a good informative and accurate content on that specific keyword and then get quality links for it once you have published it. What importance will this serve? Well, link building is all about leaving traces and tracks of your content in other people’s websites and social media. If you can manage leave as many traces as possible, it will make search engines aware of the great influence and link your article gets and how many clicks the article is getting too. They will perceive this way; if many people love this article, it must be a great one so let’s rank it on top so that all people can benefit from it also, as explained earlier. That’s how you are going to get a better ranking for that keyword. Popular Ways to Getting Backlinks So you are probably wondering, if this is how helpful building links for my website can be, how then can I build quality links the best way, right? There are many legit ways that search engines accept for bloggers to build links using, but there are those ways that give outstanding results. If you want to get such rewarding results, here are some of the best ways that even expert bloggers are using to build links for their websites: Guest Posting – writing articles for an influential blog is one of the ways you can use to link your site to that blog. If the blog is good enough, you should be seeing results in days. What happens is that search engines rank influential sites quick, which means the article you will have written as a guest post will go on the web real quick. Related: Blogging Tips Blogs That Accept Guest Post At the middle of the article, you get a chance to naturally insert a link to your site. If you leverage this opportunity, you are sure to add some influence on your site. PBN’s – PBN stands for Private Blog Network; this involves a series of blogs owned by one person that are used to build links for another blog of that same person, which is most likely a money making blog. This strategy has become so popular, and it has been undoubtedly paying some bloggers, but the better part of it is draining the value and worth of your site. It is basically a black hat technique which Google detects and penalizes people for so the best recommendation for this is just to keep off of it. (More of this will be discussed later.) Web 2.0 – This is a newer version of World Wide Web, which involves the transition of the older static pages of HTML to more dynamic ones that help users to work together and share different kinds of information on the web. This term had been used in a more technical way before that didn’t quite bring its impact. With this kind of technological advancement, it is easy to build many links to your site without having to add your own codes to the static HTML pages as it was before. Most popular web 2.0’s sites are BlogSpot, Weebly, WordPress, Tumblr, and Wix. Blog Comment – this is another well-known tactic that people use. What happens here is that people go through other blogs on their niche and then in the comments section they leave a relevant comment that has a link to their article. Similar: How To Find Similar Niche Blogs for Blog Commenting This then comes to pay when other users come to that website and happen to go through the comments. If they happen to find the comment with the link to be somewhat enticing, they click on it and are taken to the website the link leads to. Article submission sites – article submission sites are sites that have been created specifically for help website administrators and bloggers to market their articles and gain better rankings easy. There are thousands of such sites on the inte.com. If you happen to submit an article to those sites, especially the quality ones that have authority, Google will rank the article well which will help people know the author and use the links you have provided through the article to get to your site. Article submission sites are like Street articles, e-zine articles, Wikipedia and such. What these are, is that they are mainly sites that people have to write an article and post them on the said sites but leave some information about themselves and links to their sites. People will get to view the sites because some article directories get instant rankings on most search engines. Directories – There has been a significant confusion between article directories and article submissions sites. Most popular directories that can boost your rank in the SERP are Dmoz and Yahoo directory. Don’t use directories excessively for your site because Google has devalued more than 90% directories in the past due to their spammy nature. Watch this video to know different ways of getting links Things to Avoid When Building Links There are some things you are going to want to keep away as do your link building if you want this tactic to add value to your website or blog. What will be listed below will only harm your campaigns and reputation in search engines and loose trust as well as good positions in the SERPs? So here is what you should avoid at all costs: PBNs – As discussed earlier, private blog.comworks are a black hat method of achieving rankings. This is trying to creating a place for your site to thrive using your own blogs and leading engines to believe you are getting links from outside when in fact you are not. Many sites have been penalized heavily for this to the point of getting banned. Others have been ranked in the last pages and have never recovered from that for years. Avoid over-optimized anchor texts – Anchor text plays a significant role in ranking your site. Moreover, if your link profile constitutes a lot of exact matches and commercial anchor text, then it attracts penalty from Google. You should diversify your anchor text and focus more on brand, generic and naked URLs. To summarize all that you should avoid, only one thing can be said, don’t try to fool Google or any other engine. It’s not worth it. Just try to build upon your branding. Make sure you are building quality links the right and accepted way, and this will earn you points and most importantly, trust, which is even stronger than points. Author Bio Yasir Khan is the owner of onlineearningmentor.com. He is an affiliate marketer and has good knowledge of SEO. He is focusing more on writing inte.com marketing product reviews on his site.
item.turbo:content:
1. What is Link Building?




This is basically having external links that point to your website on other external pages and posts of other websites. Link building gives more exposure to your site, get better rankings on popular search engines and direct a good deal of traffic to your site for conversions or sales or any other intended purpose.


If you have links, especially in websites that have ranked in the first three positions in Google, Bing or Yahoo, it may have a huge positive impact regarding exposure on your site. Just take a second and think, how much traffic does the website that’s ranked the first get every day?


A huge load of it! And what if you could tap into it and share the traffic with your site? That would really make a huge difference in your site.


So if you can manage to talk that site’s owner into letting you leave a link or a couple of them there, you can get to see a significant rise in rankings in your online business.


And that’s how link building came to be!




  1. No, Follow vs. Do Follow Links




The do follow types of links have been around for a long time, but a no follow link has been around since 2005, after a dire need to solve the issue of spammers of other people’s sites securing good places for their sites in the search engines. Let’s catch a good glimpse of these types of links.



  • A do follow link is a link that is counted as a point by Google search bots and adds more into the link juice that boosts a site’s rankings in the SERPs. What this basically means is that it is a link left on a website (like New York Times or Forbes), and it passes link power to the site where the link is pointing.


Having more of these shows Google that many people are linking to a certain page to your site, which then means that the page must be really good. And in Google’s effort to deliver quality to their users, they will rank the page higher in the SERP’s to help many people find it and enjoy it as well.



  • A no follow link is a link that doesn’t count in the placing of your site in the search engines. There is no link juice for this kind of link, which means that it’s not going to make any difference to the site of the person who left it.


There is actually a HTML attribute for this link. Here it is -> ” <a href=”http://www.website.com/”; rel=”nofollow”>Link Text</a>”


What the attribute says is that this link should not count on its players. As said earlier, this link came to be after many people realized that the most inbound links there were for their sites, no matter where or how could gain them a boost.


This later leads to a messy situation where links were all over the place, and now it was not a matter of authenticity but a dirty competition to win good positions. So getting the links not to make any difference or bring any pointers to their destination was the perfect solution.


Are no follow links worth it then?


Sure they are! Although they don’t exert any SEO energy, they usually serve a good way of getting referral traffic that can then be channel the traffic your site and give you a lot of leads and conversions too! If well placed as a blog comment or a post it can really make more impact than rankings would.


The main reason for fighting for good rankings is to get more traffic, and if you get leads and conversions out of the no follow links instead of rankings, then they are well worth the short!




  1. Importance of Link Building in Ranking a Keyword




If you are looking for making money online then you must rank your money keywords on Google top three positions. Link building is the way to go! If you have been wondering how to rank a keyword that you have found a fit for awesome conversions and would want to have a good placing under it, inbound links can help you do that.


What you will only need to do is to write a good article on that keyword, a good informative and accurate content on that specific keyword and then get quality links for it once you have published it.


What importance will this serve?


Well, link building is all about leaving traces and tracks of your content in other people’s websites and social media. If you can manage leave as many traces as possible, it will make search engines aware of the great influence and link your article gets and how many clicks the article is getting too.


They will perceive this way; if many people love this article, it must be a great one so let’s rank it on top so that all people can benefit from it also, as explained earlier. That’s how you are going to get a better ranking for that keyword.




  1. Popular Ways to Getting Backlinks




So you are probably wondering, if this is how helpful building links for my website can be, how then can I build quality links the best way, right? There are many legit ways that search engines accept for bloggers to build links using, but there are those ways that give outstanding results. If you want to get such rewarding results, here are some of the best ways that even expert bloggers are using to build links for their websites:



  • Guest Posting – writing articles for an influential blog is one of the ways you can use to link your site to that blog. If the blog is good enough, you should be seeing results in days. What happens is that search engines rank influential sites quick, which means the article you will have written as a guest post will go on the web real quick.


Related: Blogging Tips Blogs That Accept Guest Post


At the middle of the article, you get a chance to naturally insert a link to your site. If you leverage this opportunity, you are sure to add some influence on your site.



  • PBN’s – PBN stands for Private Blog Network; this involves a series of blogs owned by one person that are used to build links for another blog of that same person, which is most likely a money making blog. This strategy has become so popular, and it has been undoubtedly paying some bloggers, but the better part of it is draining the value and worth of your site.


It is basically a black hat technique which Google detects and penalizes people for so the best recommendation for this is just to keep off of it. (More of this will be discussed later.)



  • Web 2.0 – This is a newer version of World Wide Web, which involves the transition of the older static pages of HTML to more dynamic ones that help users to work together and share different kinds of information on the web.


This term had been used in a more technical way before that didn’t quite bring its impact. With this kind of technological advancement, it is easy to build many links to your site without having to add your own codes to the static HTML pages as it was before. Most popular web 2.0’s sites are BlogSpot, Weebly, WordPress, Tumblr, and Wix.



  • Blog Comment – this is another well-known tactic that people use. What happens here is that people go through other blogs on their niche and then in the comments section they leave a relevant comment that has a link to their article.


Similar: How To Find Similar Niche Blogs for Blog Commenting


This then comes to pay when other users come to that website and happen to go through the comments. If they happen to find the comment with the link to be somewhat enticing, they click on it and are taken to the website the link leads to.



  • Article submission sites – article submission sites are sites that have been created specifically for help website administrators and bloggers to market their articles and gain better rankings easy.


There are thousands of such sites on the inte.com. If you happen to submit an article to those sites, especially the quality ones that have authority, Google will rank the article well which will help people know the author and use the links you have provided through the article to get to your site.


Article submission sites are like Street articles, e-zine articles, Wikipedia and such. What these are, is that they are mainly sites that people have to write an article and post them on the said sites but leave some information about themselves and links to their sites. People will get to view the sites because some article directories get instant rankings on most search engines.



  • Directories – There has been a significant confusion between article directories and article submissions sites. Most popular directories that can boost your rank in the SERP are Dmoz and Yahoo directory. Don’t use directories excessively for your site because Google has devalued more than 90% directories in the past due to their spammy nature.


Watch this video to know different ways of getting links



Things to Avoid When Building Links


There are some things you are going to want to keep away as do your link building if you want this tactic to add value to your website or blog. What will be listed below will only harm your campaigns and reputation in search engines and loose trust as well as good positions in the SERPs? So here is what you should avoid at all costs:



  • PBNs – As discussed earlier, private blog.comworks are a black hat method of achieving rankings. This is trying to creating a place for your site to thrive using your own blogs and leading engines to believe you are getting links from outside when in fact you are not. Many sites have been penalized heavily for this to the point of getting banned. Others have been ranked in the last pages and have never recovered from that for years.

  • Avoid over-optimized anchor texts – Anchor text plays a significant role in ranking your site. Moreover, if your link profile constitutes a lot of exact matches and commercial anchor text, then it attracts penalty from Google. You should diversify your anchor text and focus more on brand, generic and naked URLs.


To summarize all that you should avoid, only one thing can be said, don’t try to fool Google or any other engine. It’s not worth it. Just try to build upon your branding. Make sure you are building quality links the right and accepted way, and this will earn you points and most importantly, trust, which is even stronger than points.


Author Bio


Yasir Khan is the owner of onlineearningmentor.com. He is an affiliate marketer and has good knowledge of SEO. He is focusing more on writing inte.com marketing product reviews on his site.

item.title: How I’ve increased my Organic traffic by 91% with Long Tail Queries
item.description: We all know that long tail keywords is the new strategy to get ranked fast on Google. Long tail keywords have a very low competition with good search volume. We also know a bunch tool to compile an awesome list of long tail keywords. But I have seen most of marketers getting confused when it comes to the integration of long tail keywords in content. So today I am going to share my recent experience of utilizing long tail keywords in my content and noticed a boost in my traffic by 91% within 4 months. The snapshot you are watching above has been taken from the google analytics account of my recent SEO project. The website is already ranked with 150 keywords on google.com. I am working on this project since 2013, and increased their conversion by 345%. In early 2015 I suggested them to target some long tail keywords for their business. They allowed me to apply that strategy, and we saw an increment in organic traffic by 91% and increment in conversion by 27%.
item.yandex:full-text: Today I am going to reveal my secret of integrating long keywords on your website to get maximum organic traffic. Long tail Keywords are specific to a single topic, so you can only target one or two long tail keywords for a single page. I personally prefer webmaster to utilize long tail keywords in dynamic content of your website. When I say dynamic content, that means I am talking about content that can be updated frequently. Like Blog Posts, Youtube videos, infographics etc. Below are the few tips for you to integrate the long tail keywords in your content. 1-Optimize the Title of your Article: Let say we are working on a website that provide body building supplements. Here is my long tail keyword I have selected for content optimization. “Body Building Supplements for beginners” and I have googled this keyword. Here are the results. The first four listings have properly optimized titles for the selected keywords. Google still gives credit to optimize titles and take them into account while ranking any webpage. 2-Optimize the Headings for your page Let’s get to the fourth listing we have found on google. For this webpage, the webmaster has optimized the H1 and H2 with the same keywords. He is actually taking advantage of putting long tail keywords in headings on his page. Keywords in H1 tags is not in the list of rankings factors of 2015 shared by moz. But when we see the above results, we have found that it still works with long tail keywords. 3-Optimize Content for long tail keywords Covering long tail keywords in page content also helps. But you have to keep in mind that you can only use these kind of keywords a few times in your content. You can bold them, but I always prefer my students to emphasize keywords, when they are optimizing the content. Let get into the same webpage example. Here is what I have found. The webpage has 800-1200 word content, and the webmaster has used his desired keyword only one time on webpage. However, he has used word “Supplements” 12 times. This shows us that his first priority was the web users and then secondly, he focused on search engines. 4-Optimize the images long tail keywords Long tail keywords can be used in image optimization. Sticking with the same example, when you see this first image in this article. You will find that this image contains optimized alternate text with keyword “Best Supplements For Beginners”. 5-Internal linking with long tail keywords Anchor Internal linking is an awesome way to get indexed and ranked fast, I always suggestion SEOs to do internal linking. Internal linking keep your old posts fresh and indexed, it helps in decreasing bounce rate and optimizing the user experience and page views. This webmaster is also taking advantage of internal linking. He added the related articles in the last of the page, all articles are already optimized with long tail keywords. We can use long tail keywords as shortcut to grow our business. With the proper strategy and integration, you can increase your organic traffic up to 50%-70%. The Conversion rate can be increased by 20%-34% as compared to head Keywords. If you are still thinking to integrate long tail keywords in your digital marketing strategy, then its time for you to stop thinking and take action. It’s not finished here, you can find a lot of information and SEO Tutorials on inte.com regarding long tail keywords. Please ask in the comment section if you have any question.
item.turbo:content:
Today I am going to reveal my secret of integrating long keywords on your website to get maximum organic traffic.


Long tail Keywords are specific to a single topic, so you can only target one or two long tail keywords for a single page. I personally prefer webmaster to utilize long tail keywords in dynamic content of your website. When I say dynamic content, that means I am talking about content that can be updated frequently. Like Blog Posts, Youtube videos, infographics etc.
Below are the few tips for you to integrate the long tail keywords in your content.


1-Optimize the Title of your Article:


Let say we are working on a website that provide body building supplements. Here is my long tail keyword I have selected for content optimization. “Body Building Supplements for beginners” and I have googled this keyword. Here are the results.



The first four listings have properly optimized titles for the selected keywords. Google still gives credit to optimize titles and take them into account while ranking any webpage.


2-Optimize the Headings for your page


Let’s get to the fourth listing we have found on google. For this webpage, the webmaster has optimized the H1 and H2 with the same keywords.




He is actually taking advantage of putting long tail keywords in headings on his page. Keywords in H1 tags is not in the list of rankings factors of 2015 shared by moz. But when we see the above results, we have found that it still works with long tail keywords.


3-Optimize Content for long tail keywords


Covering long tail keywords in page content also helps. But you have to keep in mind that you can only use these kind of keywords a few times in your content. You can bold them, but I always prefer my students to emphasize keywords, when they are optimizing the content. Let get into the same webpage example. Here is what I have found.


The webpage has 800-1200 word content, and the webmaster has used his desired keyword only one time on webpage.



However, he has used word “Supplements” 12 times. This shows us that his first priority was the web users and then secondly, he focused on search engines.


4-Optimize the images long tail keywords


Long tail keywords can be used in image optimization. Sticking with the same example, when you see this first image in this article.



You will find that this image contains optimized alternate text with keyword “Best Supplements For Beginners”.


5-Internal linking with long tail keywords Anchor


Internal linking is an awesome way to get indexed and ranked fast, I always suggestion SEOs to do internal linking. Internal linking keep your old posts fresh and indexed, it helps in decreasing bounce rate and optimizing the user experience and page views. This webmaster is also taking advantage of internal linking. He added the related articles in the last of the page, all articles are already optimized with long tail keywords.



We can use long tail keywords as shortcut to grow our business. With the proper strategy and integration, you can increase your organic traffic up to 50%-70%. The Conversion rate can be increased by 20%-34% as compared to head Keywords.


If you are still thinking to integrate long tail keywords in your digital marketing strategy, then its time for you to stop thinking and take action. It’s not finished here, you can find a lot of information and SEO Tutorials on inte.com regarding long tail keywords.


Please ask in the comment section if you have any question.

item.title: Manage your Old & Outdated Content with these SEO Tips
item.description: Expired content is basically is old piece of information about something which is no longer relevant. Examples range from products which are no longer continued, products which are only available in certain seasons to items which are currently out of stock. How to Control Lapsed Content?
item.yandex:full-text: Keep away from exercising a 404 error on your old content because this type of error gives the impression that there is a fault with your page. This damages your brand credibility. Use a 404 only when you want your page to be dead i.e. not accessed by anyone anymore. In the case of a 404 error message try to make the visitors still interested in your content by adding a few images and links at the end of the message. The links will take the viewers to your newly published attractive content which in turn will take their minds off from the unappealing 404. You can apply a 301 permanent redirect by creating a customized note where you mention the reason due to which the user is being redirected to other websites. To avoid confusion in the minds of your customers, be clear why they are being redirected by stating in a message that you are sorry for causing inconvenience and that the product is no longer accessible. While using 301 you can direct users to a new place where they have the option of getting something valuable and this would make up for the unnecessary hassle. Keep the expired content on the site. This might surprise and shock you at the same time, but research shows that if the past content was interesting and provided valuable knowledge to the users keeping it intact might help you indirectly. For example, if there was a poll on the most popular thing sold on your site in a particular month, then keep that information still there and let the users know that they can keep a tab on your polling section for future polls which will prove to be beneficial for them to decide what to buy and what to give a miss. But be sure to keep only valuable expired content since if you try to maintain all the old and new stuff simultaneously on your site, it will not only create confusion to both you and the users but your site may also crash and cause harassment. One needs to revise past content for the following reasons: To boost your brand’s image: No one will want to rely on your old content when your competitors like the SEO agency in Syracuse are coming up with new and exciting content every day. You need to showcase your worth by trying to eliminate completion and be in your customer’s good books. One of the ways to achieve this is to constantly update your site. Be in the good books of Google: You should examine your content on a daily basis and check whether its quality is being neglected or not. You need to be careful when you do this since Google Panda marks weak content. You can make your content updated by certain ways: Reimprovise your posts by checking the facts. In this digital age, things seldom remain the same and so you need to modify all the statistics and data if and when it is required. If the links become old and replaceable, you change them before they become outdated. You also need to consider the SEO. Apart from keeping the URL the same as before you should also stop yourself from changing the headlines and key phrases. Reformat your content so that it becomes easily readable to the average person. Keep the paragraphs short and avoid unnecessary complicated words. Highlight the best parts and include images if possible. CTAS should be replaced to make your posts apt for your target audience. After you have made the required changes, it is time to republish and redistribute your material. One clever way to attract the viewer is to change the date of publication to show that your information is current. Once you get a rough idea about how to handle your old and outdated content, you must classify all the terminated pages and then decide which source to use. Some pages might need 301 redirection while 404 error messages are suitable for others. Ultimately, it is in your hand to decide what goes best for your website and what doesn’t when it comes to old content.
item.turbo:content:
1. Keep away from exercising a 404 error on your old content because this type of error gives the impression that there is a fault with your page. This damages your brand credibility. Use a 404 only when you want your page to be dead i.e. not accessed by anyone anymore. In the case of a 404 error message try to make the visitors still interested in your content by adding a few images and links at the end of the message. The links will take the viewers to your newly published attractive content which in turn will take their minds off from the unappealing 404.

  2. You can apply a 301 permanent redirect by creating a customized note where you mention the reason due to which the user is being redirected to other websites. To avoid confusion in the minds of your customers, be clear why they are being redirected by stating in a message that you are sorry for causing inconvenience and that the product is no longer accessible. While using 301 you can direct users to a new place where they have the option of getting something valuable and this would make up for the unnecessary hassle.

  3. Keep the expired content on the site. This might surprise and shock you at the same time, but research shows that if the past content was interesting and provided valuable knowledge to the users keeping it intact might help you indirectly. For example, if there was a poll on the most popular thing sold on your site in a particular month, then keep that information still there and let the users know that they can keep a tab on your polling section for future polls which will prove to be beneficial for them to decide what to buy and what to give a miss. But be sure to keep only valuable expired content since if you try to maintain all the old and new stuff simultaneously on your site, it will not only create confusion to both you and the users but your site may also crash and cause harassment.


One needs to revise past content for the following reasons:



  • To boost your brand’s image: No one will want to rely on your old content when your competitors like the SEO agency in Syracuse are coming up with new and exciting content every day. You need to showcase your worth by trying to eliminate completion and be in your customer’s good books. One of the ways to achieve this is to constantly update your site.

  • Be in the good books of Google: You should examine your content on a daily basis and check whether its quality is being neglected or not. You need to be careful when you do this since Google Panda marks weak content.


You can make your content updated by certain ways:



  1. Reimprovise your posts by checking the facts. In this digital age, things seldom remain the same and so you need to modify all the statistics and data if and when it is required. If the links become old and replaceable, you change them before they become outdated. You also need to consider the SEO. Apart from keeping the URL the same as before you should also stop yourself from changing the headlines and key phrases.

  2. Reformat your content so that it becomes easily readable to the average person. Keep the paragraphs short and avoid unnecessary complicated words. Highlight the best parts and include images if possible.

  3. CTAS should be replaced to make your posts apt for your target audience.

  4. After you have made the required changes, it is time to republish and redistribute your material. One clever way to attract the viewer is to change the date of publication to show that your information is current.


Once you get a rough idea about how to handle your old and outdated content, you must classify all the terminated pages and then decide which source to use. Some pages might need 301 redirection while 404 error messages are suitable for others. Ultimately, it is in your hand to decide what goes best for your website and what doesn’t when it comes to old content.

item.title: On-Page SEO Checklist | Top 40 Points for WordPress Blog
item.description: On-Page SEO is one of the most important parts of your website to make it search engine friendly and get huge traffic from search engines. So you must understand how you will optimize your website to make your site search engines friendly and get massive traffic from search engines. We know that, WordPress is one of the most important CMS because of its several features. SEO friendly is one of the most popular and attractive feature of WordPress CMS. So people love to use WordPress CMS to build their personal or professional website or blog. So in this post, I’m going to share some important On-Page SEO Checklist. Here are the top 40 points, that’s you must consider for a WordPress blog. Using this On-Page SEO Checklist, you can optimize your WordPress site/blog for search engines and brings more traffic to your blog easily and quickly. So let’s check the list now and take proper step for your WP blog now. On-Page SEO Checklist
item.yandex:full-text: Have You Install an SEO Friendly WordPress Theme? To build a website or professional blog with WordPress, at first you must choose an SEO friendly WordPress Theme. When you are planning to build a blog with WordPress, because most of the newbie bloggers haven’t enough to buy a premium WordPress Theme. But the problem is that, free themes are not optimized for SEO and can harm your site ranking. So you must go for Premium Theme. Have You Set Your Blog URL? When you install WordPress first time on your blog, you must set a default URL for your blog with WWW or without WWW. Although there is no major difference in with and without WWW, but you must set the URL and use this everywhere, such as during verifying Google or Bing Webmaster tool. Remember that, you can’t change the default URL frequently, because it may hurt your SEO ranking. Have You Set Search Engine Friendly Permalink? URL optimization is one of the most important parts of on-page SEO. You should make your blog/site URL search engine friendly to get a good SEO score and drive traffic from search engines. In WordPress CMS, you can set the default permalink for your site/blog. You should make your blog default permalink . Have You Checked That your Blog Indexed or De-Indexed? When you install WordPress first time, your blog will get indexed in Search Engines like Google, Bing or Yahoo automatically. You should make your blog de-indexed until your blog will ready with proper settings and some awesome contents. You can easily hide your blog from search engines, just go to your blog admin panel, then go to the Setting> Reading and check the box Discourage search engines from indexing this site. Have Install, Active and configure essential WordPress Plugins? After installing WordPress first time, you should install some essential WordPress plugins to make run and manage your blog as well as to make it search engines and user friendly. Here are some essential WordPress plugins Akismet (To protect your blog from spam comments) WP Super Cache (To improve blog performance by improving loading time) Jetpack (This is an official WordPress plugin comes with several features for both admin to end users) WordPress SEO by Yoast (To make your blog search engine friendly and increase search traffic) WP-Optimize (To improve blog loading time by optimizing database) TablePress (To insert table in pages and posts) Pretty Link Lite (Essential Plugin for Affiliate Marketing Blog) Limit Login Attempts (To protect your blog from hacking attempts or malware) Broken Link Checker (To remove broken links from your blog) SumoMe (To add social sharing button, image sharing button, collect email subscribers and much more) Have you verified your blog on Google and Bing Webmaster Tool? When all essential settings are done and if you’ve started your blog with a new domain, then you must verify the ownership of your domain in Google Webmaster Tool and Bing Webmaster Tool. Just log in the Google Webmaster tool using a Gmail ID and verify your domain. Do same in Bing Webmaster Tool also. Do you Setup Google Analytics for Your Blog? Google Analytics in one of the most popular and effective ways to see and analyze details traffic reports of any blog. So when you start blogging with a new domain, you must set up Google Analytics. Just go to the Google Analytics, create an account with Gmail ID, get the tracking code and insert in your blog. Do you create and Submit XML sitemap in Google and Bing Webmaster Tool? An XML sitemap is one of the important elements for a blog/site. You must create an XML site for your blog and submit in Google and Bing Webmaster Tool. This will help to get your blog new post/page indexed easily and quickly. To create an XML site in a WordPress blog, just install the Google XML Sitemap Plugin or you will find an XML sitemap option in WordPress SEO by Yoast Plugin. Just click on “Check this box to enable XML sitemap functionality” in WordPress SEO by Yoast. Do you create a Robots.txt File? Just like an XML Sitemap file, a Robots.txt file is also important for a blog/site. This file will let search engines which files and folders will they crawl and indexed and which will not. Here you can allow search engine bots to index your site specific files and folders. Just create a notepad file with the name ‘Robots.txt’ and the following cods for WordPress blog only. Here is the example of an Ideal Robotx.txt file code. User-agent: * Disallow: /cgi-bin/ Disallow: /wp-admin/ Disallow: /wp-includes/ Disallow: /recommended/ Disallow: /comments/feed/ Disallow: /trackback/ Disallow: /index.php Disallow: /xmlrpc.php Disallow: /get/ Disallow: /go/ User-agent: Googlebot-Image Allow: /wp-content/uploads/ User-agent: Mediapartners-Google Disallow: User-agent: Googlebot-Mobile Allow: / Sitemap: http://www.yourdomain.com/sitemap_index.xml Do you create About, Contact and Privacy Policy Page? About, Contact and Privacy Policy/Terms of Condition/Disclaimer pages are most important for a blog/site. You must create an about page with detail information on your blog. Then create a contact page so that your visitors can easily contact with you for any kind information or query. Finally, create a privacy polity/disclaimer or terms of condition page for your blog. Do you update your profile information? Do you delete unused themes and plugins? Do you select some Keywords for upcoming post? If not, then select some keywords using the Google Keyword Planner Tool. Do you include your targeted keyword/keywords in the Homepage title? Do you check the title length of your blog? Is your blog contents are fresh, relevant and attractive? Do you use relevant, unique and attractive Meta description tag? Do you include your targeted keyword/keywords in permalink? Do you use the H1 Tag in your Blog content? Do you use some H2, H3 and H4 tag in your blog content? Have you used interlink in your blog content? Have you used outbound link your content? Is your content long enough? Try to post every new content with minimum 1,500 Words. Have you used LSI keywords in your blog content? Have you include the primary keyword in first 100 words of your blog content naturally? Have you included targeted keyword/keywords in sub-title/sub-heading? Have you checked the grammatical and spelling error of the content? Have you used some relevant images in your blog content? Use at least one image inside per content. Have you created and submit an XML sitemap file for images? Have you optimized images for search engines and users? Have you checked your blog loading time? Have you used permanent redirect (301) for a preferred domain, such as with or without WWW? Have you implemented rel=”next” and rel=”prev” tags for better user navigation? Have you used a canonical tag? Have you optimized homepage content? Have you checked your blog is mobile friendly or not? Have you used schema markup properly? Have you used Google Knowledge Graph? Have you created Social Profile for your blog on Popular Social Networking and Social Bookmarking sites? Have you verified your blog in Google+ page? So, here are some points for On-Page SEO Checklist. Hope, you will find this list helpful to make your WordPress blog/site search engine friendly and get more traffic from search engines. Also, please let me know by commenting below, if I’ve missed to include any points in this On-Page SEO Checklist.
item.turbo:content:
1. Have You Install an SEO Friendly WordPress Theme?




To build a website or professional blog with WordPress, at first you must choose an SEO friendly WordPress Theme.
When you are planning to build a blog with WordPress, because most of the newbie bloggers haven’t enough to buy a premium WordPress Theme. But the problem is that, free themes are not optimized for SEO and can harm your site ranking. So you must go for Premium Theme.





  1. Have You Set Your Blog URL?




When you install WordPress first time on your blog, you must set a default URL for your blog with WWW or without WWW. Although there is no major difference in with and without WWW, but you must set the URL and use this everywhere, such as during verifying Google or Bing Webmaster tool. Remember that, you can’t change the default URL frequently, because it may hurt your SEO ranking.




  1. Have You Set Search Engine Friendly Permalink?




URL optimization is one of the most important parts of on-page SEO. You should make your blog/site URL search engine friendly to get a good SEO score and drive traffic from search engines. In WordPress CMS, you can set the default permalink for your site/blog. You should make your blog default permalink .




  1. Have You Checked That your Blog Indexed or De-Indexed?




When you install WordPress first time, your blog will get indexed in Search Engines like Google, Bing or Yahoo automatically. You should make your blog de-indexed until your blog will ready with proper settings and some awesome contents. You can easily hide your blog from search engines, just go to your blog admin panel, then go to the Setting> Reading and check the box Discourage search engines from indexing this site.




  1. Have Install, Active and configure essential WordPress Plugins?




After installing WordPress first time, you should install some essential WordPress plugins to make run and manage your blog as well as to make it search engines and user friendly. Here are some essential WordPress plugins



  • Akismet (To protect your blog from spam comments)

  • WP Super Cache (To improve blog performance by improving loading time)

  • Jetpack (This is an official WordPress plugin comes with several features for both admin to end users)

  • WordPress SEO by Yoast (To make your blog search engine friendly and increase search traffic)

  • WP-Optimize (To improve blog loading time by optimizing database)

  • TablePress (To insert table in pages and posts)

  • Pretty Link Lite (Essential Plugin for Affiliate Marketing Blog)

  • Limit Login Attempts (To protect your blog from hacking attempts or malware)

  • Broken Link Checker (To remove broken links from your blog)

  • SumoMe (To add social sharing button, image sharing button, collect email subscribers and much more)




  1. Have you verified your blog on Google and Bing Webmaster Tool?




When all essential settings are done and if you’ve started your blog with a new domain, then you must verify the ownership of your domain in Google Webmaster Tool and Bing Webmaster Tool. Just log in the Google Webmaster tool using a Gmail ID and verify your domain. Do same in Bing Webmaster Tool also.




  1. Do you Setup Google Analytics for Your Blog?




Google Analytics in one of the most popular and effective ways to see and analyze details traffic reports of any blog. So when you start blogging with a new domain, you must set up Google Analytics. Just go to the Google Analytics, create an account with Gmail ID, get the tracking code and insert in your blog.




  1. Do you create and Submit XML sitemap in Google and Bing Webmaster Tool?




An XML sitemap is one of the important elements for a blog/site. You must create an XML site for your blog and submit in Google and Bing Webmaster Tool. This will help to get your blog new post/page indexed easily and quickly. To create an XML site in a WordPress blog, just install the Google XML Sitemap Plugin or you will find an XML sitemap option in WordPress SEO by Yoast Plugin. Just click on “Check this box to enable XML sitemap functionality” in WordPress SEO by Yoast.




  1. Do you create a Robots.txt File?




Just like an XML Sitemap file, a Robots.txt file is also important for a blog/site. This file will let search engines which files and folders will they crawl and indexed and which will not. Here you can allow search engine bots to index your site specific files and folders. Just create a notepad file with the name ‘Robots.txt’ and the following cods for WordPress blog only. Here is the example of an Ideal Robotx.txt file code.



User-agent: *


Disallow: /cgi-bin/


Disallow: /wp-admin/


Disallow: /wp-includes/


Disallow: /recommended/


Disallow: /comments/feed/


Disallow: /trackback/


Disallow: /index.php


Disallow: /xmlrpc.php


Disallow: /get/


Disallow: /go/


User-agent: Googlebot-Image


Allow: /wp-content/uploads/


User-agent: Mediapartners-Google


Disallow:


User-agent: Googlebot-Mobile


Allow: /


Sitemap: http://www.yourdomain.com/sitemap_index.xml





  1. Do you create About, Contact and Privacy Policy Page?




About, Contact and Privacy Policy/Terms of Condition/Disclaimer pages are most important for a blog/site. You must create an about page with detail information on your blog. Then create a contact page so that your visitors can easily contact with you for any kind information or query. Finally, create a privacy polity/disclaimer or terms of condition page for your blog.



  1. Do you update your profile information?

  2. Do you delete unused themes and plugins?

  3. Do you select some Keywords for upcoming post? If not, then select some keywords using the Google Keyword Planner Tool.

  4. Do you include your targeted keyword/keywords in the Homepage title?

  5. Do you check the title length of your blog?

  6. Is your blog contents are fresh, relevant and attractive?

  7. Do you use relevant, unique and attractive Meta description tag?

  8. Do you include your targeted keyword/keywords in permalink?

  9. Do you use the H1 Tag in your Blog content?

  10. Do you use some H2, H3 and H4 tag in your blog content?

  11. Have you used interlink in your blog content?

  12. Have you used outbound link your content?

  13. Is your content long enough? Try to post every new content with minimum 1,500 Words.

  14. Have you used LSI keywords in your blog content?

  15. Have you include the primary keyword in first 100 words of your blog content naturally?

  16. Have you included targeted keyword/keywords in sub-title/sub-heading?

  17. Have you checked the grammatical and spelling error of the content?

  18. Have you used some relevant images in your blog content? Use at least one image inside per content.

  19. Have you created and submit an XML sitemap file for images?

  20. Have you optimized images for search engines and users?

  21. Have you checked your blog loading time?

  22. Have you used permanent redirect (301) for a preferred domain, such as with or without WWW?

  23. Have you implemented rel=”next” and rel=”prev” tags for better user navigation?

  24. Have you used a canonical tag?

  25. Have you optimized homepage content?

  26. Have you checked your blog is mobile friendly or not?

  27. Have you used schema markup properly?

  28. Have you used Google Knowledge Graph?

  29. Have you created Social Profile for your blog on Popular Social Networking and Social Bookmarking sites?

  30. Have you verified your blog in Google+ page?


So, here are some points for On-Page SEO Checklist. Hope, you will find this list helpful to make your WordPress blog/site search engine friendly and get more traffic from search engines.


Also, please let me know by commenting below, if I’ve missed to include any points in this On-Page SEO Checklist.

item.title: 9 Best Free Backlink Generators
item.description: May be, you often avoid free backlink generator. You think, the free backlink generator is useless and fake. But, I tell you, if you can choose the best free backlink creating services, it can be a big help because the top free generator works like a human being. But, the difficulty is to find out the best free backlink generator. So, I am helping you. I selected 9 SEO service providers who create automatic backlinks for free, but in effective ways. I select them because they have a highly qualified list of websites with dofollow link status and high page rank. So, if you take service from these free backlink creators, I think you can save much time that you can put another effort. Anyway guys, let me tell you the top 9 free backlink generator tools.
item.yandex:full-text: 1. LinkSearching LinkSearching is an free link building tools.Its a tool that mainly helps you to find the websites for your backlink building. It shows the sites that you command on its search box. LinkSearching uses the footprint technology to search the websites as you want. This tool is able to bring out the relevant, higher page rank, forum sites, .edu sites, .gov sites and all other websites where you can put your backlinks. VIEW TOOL 2. Real-backlinks Real-backlinks is an automated tool to create solid backlinks. This generator gives you 100 real backlinks for free that impact your ranking on the Google, Bing and Yahoo. It’s 95% free backlinks are dofollow. It needs only 2 minutes to create 100 links. They offer you to get Google rank #2 in 1-2 months. VIEW TOOL 3. Small SEO Tools Many marketers know, Small SEO Tools is the best and biggest free service for all kinds of SEO movements. They have also a free backlink creator tool that works great to generate free backlinks. They offer you high value backlinks in a few seconds. You can try this generator. VIEW TOOL 4. Backlink Generator Backlink Generator is a software for creating free backlinks. This tool offers you to create 325 instant and free backlinks that are also permanent, good and high quality. So, it can be a good free-backlink service for you. VIEW TOOL 5. Sito Web Info Sito Web Info has also a high quality service for creating free backlinks. 1. LinkSearching


LinkSearching is an free link building tools.Its a tool that mainly helps you to find the websites for your backlink building. It shows the sites that you command on its search box. LinkSearching uses the footprint technology to search the websites as you want. This tool is able to bring out the relevant, higher page rank, forum sites, .edu sites, .gov sites and all other websites where you can put your backlinks.

Real-backlinks is an automated tool to create solid backlinks. This generator gives you 100 real backlinks for free that impact your ranking on the Google, Bing and Yahoo. It’s 95% free backlinks are dofollow. It needs only 2 minutes to create 100 links. They offer you to get Google rank #2 in 1-2 months.
